website_summaries.verdict: A revised edition of a classic with hundreds of new full-color photos and the reliability of the Audubon name.
pros: Two books available - western and eastern regions to make your search easier and your book thinner
Features pictures of the flowers in their habitats
Images arranged by color and shape make them easy to find
cons: Though these books are quite comprehensive, you will need to buy two in order to get the whole North American fauna

customer_reviews.title: This is a great guide for anyone new to wildflowers
customer_reviews.text: This is a great guide for anyone new to wildflowers. The pictures make it easy to identify the flowers you spot in the wild. ... I also love the Petersen's Guide--which, for instance, is better about teaching you the different parts of a flower and the different kinds of leaves, and also has more evocative descriptions. It also includes many more species. But Petersen's is better once you get a little more advanced, because it's a bit harder to identify the flowers you find using that one.
customer_reviews.author: M. Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful wildflowers field guide
customer_reviews.text: Husband is a cellular biologist/biotechnologist and LOVES the National Audubon Society field guides. He is slowly building his field guide collection and was thrilled to add this one to it. He's taken it on a few hikes and found it useful. My 10 year old nature-loving son has read many pages in it and found it interesting and was able to identify a few flowers in our neighborhood. These are wonderful books and I highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: J. Harbin

customer_reviews.title: Great starter guide
customer_reviews.text: Great starter guide, easy to use as plants sorted by color. I assumed it was fairly comprehensive and wanted to use it to ID wildflowers in my yard. Several have not been in this guide and I will need to hunt down a more comprehensive guide.
customer_reviews.author: yellowwood

customer_reviews.title: Makes identification ridiculously easy
customer_reviews.text: This is a great field guide that makes identifying wildflowers super easy. The pictures are very clear and the identification system are simple to follow. Has a lot of information for each plant. Thick little book, plastic cover, sturdy binding. Great overall.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney D.

customer_reviews.title: Great companion to take on hikes.
customer_reviews.text: This book is a great companion to take on hikes, if you're into viewing wildflowers while hiking.
customer_reviews.author: 2shy

customer_reviews.title: Nice guide
customer_reviews.text: I like these guides, I’ve had read them and bought them before. I enjoy the updated version of it, there’s more flowers than the previous guide before this one. The organization of the flower groups are easy to understand and find.
customer_reviews.author: Dash10

customer_reviews.title: Wildflowers- The Best!
customer_reviews.text: What could be better than a book about wildflowers? As with the other books in this series- it is richly illustrated with distribution charts and multiple factoids. A must if you are out hiking in the spring.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Salniker

customer_reviews.title: Good guide
customer_reviews.text: Great photos, great info. My kids wanted to know the names of the flowers as we hiked, I have forgotten a lot so book is great. The first flower we looked up was not in the book (star of Bethlehem) so that was disappointing. But good book overall.
customer_reviews.author: B. Witt

customer_reviews.title: My dad loves it
customer_reviews.text: My dad loved receiving this book. It's a great gift and nice to have on hand. I never imagined that a book would bring such entertainment and conversation about the outdoors.
customer_reviews.author: Banshee

customer_reviews.title: excellent book to casually identify wild flowers
customer_reviews.text: All the Audubon books I have are very high quality have great pictures and are easy to use. I use it mostly to identify wild flowers I have taken pictures of its not easy but you can do it might be easier int he field where you know the size some flowers look the same except for size.
customer_reviews.author: John WenzelburgerTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Great book for Nature lovers
customer_reviews.text: Bought for a gift and they love it. Perfect size
customer_reviews.author: April P.

customer_reviews.title: Makes a wonderful gift.
customer_reviews.text: We give these a gifts to people moving to our area.
customer_reviews.author: Aussie owner

customer_reviews.title: Great books!
customer_reviews.text: Can't go wrong with a "National Audubon Society" Guide of any kind, and this one is no exception. Easy to understand and the pictures are fantastic. Makes identifying wildflowers easy.
customer_reviews.author: Astara

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Guide for Identification
customer_reviews.text: There are excellent photos in this book, grouped by color and then by flower complexity. Each picture in the photos section then has a reference to a printed page where detailed information about the plant/flower is presented. It is easy to use and great for an "amateur". My only complaint with the book is that there simply isn't quite enough of it... but, overall it is far and away the best wildflower book I've seen and I have about a dozen different books I use to try to identify wildflowers.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Dutton

customer_reviews.title: Nice guide
customer_reviews.text: My mother is a flower lover and an avid gardener for most of her life. Nice photos & descriptions of flowers. Reasonable price and durable cover. Nice for a gift or just to have on the book shelf.
customer_reviews.author: Renee

customer_reviews.title: Excellent reference book
customer_reviews.text: Excellent reference book....My wife likes it, fun on spring & summer hikes, but it takes up some room in the pack. Cool though.
customer_reviews.author: J. Bishop

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: A must have for all who want to see what's in your backyard or on a field trip.
customer_reviews.author: Beverly Coleman

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I expected.
customer_reviews.text: Just what I was looking for. I have the Western edition and I moved back east so I was in need of this edition. Its nice to be able to identify the wild flowers where I live. The pictures are clear and its written well.
customer_reviews.author: sunfire

customer_reviews.title: Field Guide to Wildflowers
customer_reviews.text: Great wildflowers resource/guide book. Well organized, easy to use, and has clear descriptions, with brilliant photos and drawings. I had given my last copy away as a gift to fellow flower lover, and glad I now have my own copy again.
customer_reviews.author: Dean Thomason

customer_reviews.title: All Audobon field guides are spectacular...
customer_reviews.text: If you only get field guide this is the one to get! Pocket/fanny pack sized, beautiful color photo's, well laid out. Condition was just as seller described.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa G,

customer_reviews.title: Well written
customer_reviews.text: Well put together guide that covers a good majority if wild flowerimg plants.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: A very good book for those gardeners interested in native flowers, especially for low-maintenance flowers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My "go to" field guide for wildflowers
customer_reviews.text: As usual, National Audubon Society published a very usable, accurate field guide. Of the 8 wildflower guides I own, this is the 1st one I go to for identification.
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn G

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality binding
customer_reviews.text: Afraid to use this book now that pages are pulling out of the binding and unfortunately I bought quite a few of the same type of field guides all in one order.
customer_reviews.author: Discerning shopper

customer_reviews.title: bought this to replace a lost one I love Audubon field guides pictures are really good to help ...
customer_reviews.text: bought this to replace a lost one I love Audubon field guides pictures are really good to help identify wildflowers when they are in bloom
customer_reviews.author: Eileen Sapaugh

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Extremely happy that I ordered this, arrived in record time
customer_reviews.author: Bugtussle

customer_reviews.title: Nature Lovers will Love It!
customer_reviews.text: My husband has several National Audubon Books and I eventually want him to have the entire set. He especially loved this book as I gave it to him at the beginning of the spring. He is constantly referring to it to figure out what type of flower he saw. The pictures are beautiful and it is handy reference guide.
customer_reviews.author: Alli K

customer_reviews.title: Great pictures and descriptions.
customer_reviews.text: I have used this book for about a year and have found it the best I have found to identify wild flowers deep in the woods and in my fields. Pictures are excellent as are the descriptions. Strongly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Tish Murphy

customer_reviews.title: The Ultimate Test
customer_reviews.text: Each of our five kids had to collect wildflower specimens and identify them with some general information for their eighth grade project. We used these books with each one and they are still in great shape after more than 10 years usage. I recently purchased the updated versions and was very pleased with the photos. I didn't really think they could get better but they did!
customer_reviews.author: T. Swedberg

customer_reviews.title: A good guide
customer_reviews.text: I was reading the novel, Rebecca, and became interested in all the flowers mentioned within it and realized that they symbolized certain things. This book helped me to learn about these flowers and thus it added to my understanding of the book!
customer_reviews.author: Julianne

customer_reviews.title: National Audubon Society Field Guide to North American Wildflowers
customer_reviews.text: I gave this four stars as it is an excellent book for wildflower enthusiast. The photos are excellent, as are the descriptions. Just a very informative book indeed for identifying wildflowers in the field or at home. It's a must have for the field or at home. I love this guide!
customer_reviews.author: Garry E. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: I love using this guide!
customer_reviews.text: I have identified many flowers already, which is super exciting! Admittedly, I have not been able to identify all the flowers that I see. I can't quite tell if it's because I'm not yet adept at identification, or if many of the flowers I am running into are part of the category that did not make it to the book. In any case, I intend to get much more usage out of it!
customer_reviews.author: STEPHANIE V THOMPSON

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Lots of great full color pictures for use in identifying flowers. Very useful.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent book as all the Audubon books are
customer_reviews.text: Excellent book as all the Audubon books are. You coukld not get a better reference book, easy to read, colorful and full of information. Simply a great gift,
customer_reviews.author: Fl. lover

customer_reviews.title: Enjoy your wildflower walks with this guide.
customer_reviews.text: Good work, put a flashlight in your back pack with this one you will want to read at night in the tent.
customer_reviews.author: Annie

customer_reviews.title: THOROUGH DETAIL APPRECIATED
customer_reviews.text: I FOUND THIS TO BE THE MOST THOROUGH AND ENJOYABLE REFERENCE BOOK. I LIKE THE COLOR PLATES THAT HAVE EXPLANATIONS/DESCRIPTIONS IN THE BACK TO CORRESPOND WITH EACH. THERE IS ALSO AN INTERESTING TIDBIT ON DERIVATION ON EACH TOO. .MUCH APPRECIATED.
customer_reviews.author: Sparklebauble

customer_reviews.title: Works as Advertised
customer_reviews.text: As an amateur photographer, I needed a book to help identify the wildflowers and this book does the trick.
customer_reviews.author: Dale R. Palmer

customer_reviews.title: Well organized and easy to use with beautiful photographs to identify wildflowers
customer_reviews.text: This wildflower field guide is well organized and it makes it easy to use. It is organized by color and by flower shapes. It really helps you identify wildflowers that you see outdoors. It is also a very usable size - not too big and not too small. The photographs of the wildflowers are also very well done and accurate.
customer_reviews.author: LISA K MCCONNELL

customer_reviews.title: It's the perfect size for my backpack
customer_reviews.text: I use this all of the time. It's the perfect size for my backpack. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Paula A.

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful help to identify flowers.
customer_reviews.text: Love these books from Audubon. Got this as a gift for my daughter. She loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: Used but looks like brand new!
customer_reviews.text: Got this at a used price, but it arrived and looks brand spanking new.
customer_reviews.author: James L. Bell

customer_reviews.title: One great book for identifying eastern wildflowers.
customer_reviews.text: One super helpful field guide for identifying wildflowers from the eastern division of the USA. Easy to use and has some very useful info to help in ensuring identity of what you may be looking at. Love this book. Definitely a book for one's library.
customer_reviews.author: rev munch

customer_reviews.title: This revised one is much better.
customer_reviews.text: I had the old book. This revised one is much better.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Reece

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful book for anyone who enjoys going out and looking at, or for wild flowers. Invaluable field guide.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Beerman

customer_reviews.title: beautiful
customer_reviews.text: I have always found myself wondering what the names of flowers are that we see while walking. Now I can find names and much more interesting information. Enjoy just looking at this book while relaxing.
customer_reviews.author: Mom of 3

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: absolutely love it. easy to use. rice paper makes it feel like a holy text <3
customer_reviews.author: Krystall E.

customer_reviews.title: You can't go wrong with this book!
customer_reviews.text: I already have this book and ordered it for my mother-in-law so she could identify wild flowers on their expansive property in West Virginia. I often refer to my own book and have identified almost all the flowers (or weeds) in question. Great photos and a great resource of information.
customer_reviews.author: Fore20

customer_reviews.title: Look just like previous edition but lots of new content
customer_reviews.text: This edition physically looks like the previous edition but when you open the pages you'll see a great deal of new content for species that were not in the earlier editions.
customer_reviews.author: Steven R. Jacobs

customer_reviews.title: Nothing bad to say
customer_reviews.text: This was bought for my 9 yr old who had expressed great interest in local wildflowers. She has greatly enjoyed it. Let's of beautiful colored photos and good info.
customer_reviews.author: Sparkler

customer_reviews.title: Love the pictures
customer_reviews.text: I love the pictures which is so helpful as compared to drawings like other books. Its seems to be of the most popular flowers and the pictures are of just one stage of the flower, but still fun to reference. I am constantly seeing something and go to the book to see if its in there! At camp there is no internet, so this book and its size works great.
customer_reviews.author: angela davis

customer_reviews.title: Great resoucre
customer_reviews.text: This book is up to the standards of other National Audubon Society publications. If you have a diverse selection of wildflowers or want to grow them, this is a good addition to your library.
customer_reviews.author: NA

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great reference book, contains "most" common flowers. We always start with the Audubon collection when looking something up.
customer_reviews.author: GTalbert

customer_reviews.title: Wildflower I.D. Made Easy
customer_reviews.text: beautiful real life pictures grouped by color make it easy to identify flowers quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy W.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Helped me identify different species - great series of books.
customer_reviews.author: Sheryl L. Donner

customer_reviews.title: Colorful edition
customer_reviews.text: Complements the colorful collection of Audobon field guides i already own (Trees, Birds, Stars, Weather). Very convenient organization and layout.
customer_reviews.author: misteradio

customer_reviews.title: Still figuring it out
customer_reviews.text: This little book is worth the money. I am still getting used to looking up the wildflowers growing alongside the road. I love the organization by color.
customer_reviews.author: J. Francis

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to understand
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this book in hopes of identifying some of the wild flowers that we have in and around our yard. This is a very confusing book, and none of the index referrals match up with the pictures or info. I guess I should have gotten a degree in horticulture before I bought this. For anyone unfamiliar with wild flowers, I would not recommend this book. If anyone knows of one that is easier to use, please let me know.
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte L. Wilcox

customer_reviews.title: Great Wildflower Guide Book
customer_reviews.text: We really like the layout and the usefulness of it. Audubon does a great job with it.
customer_reviews.author: Sean D. Clarkin

customer_reviews.title: Wild flower field guide.
customer_reviews.text: I had field guides to wildflowers before but this is the one that I can usually find the flowers in. I like the way it is organized too.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I gave it as a gift and they love it

customer_reviews.title: Field Guide to Flowers
customer_reviews.text: I like all the field guides put out by the National Audubon Society the flower guide will be of greet use

customer_reviews.title: Guide to wild flowers of N America
customer_reviews.text: Has an extensive collection of wild flowers. Very impressive! This is what I needed. Great for beginners and field reps.

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for nature lovers
customer_reviews.text: Gave it for a gift to a friend who nearly wore my copy out. He loves it. Great gift for nature lovers.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: A great resource. Pictures could be a litter better. But its great.
customer_reviews.author: JoRo

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't seem to have all of the Flowers
customer_reviews.text: But it does a good job, great photos and descriptions, nice feel and size and I don't have to log into anything to use it!
customer_reviews.author: Clarice

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Illustrations
customer_reviews.text: This is a great field guide to North American Wildflowers. The illustrations are wonderful and the book comes in very handy when going on weekend hikes and camping!
customer_reviews.author: MWade

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to find what you are looking for with the ...
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to find what you are looking for with the colored pictures of all the flowers grouped according to colors. Under each one is a basic description and a page number where the full description is given.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Chizek

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Just what I expected . Have had the mushroom book for many years
customer_reviews.author: Ryknow

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Book received in timely manner as advertised, good as new and just as I expected it to be. Would happily do business with them again.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love the book
customer_reviews.text: I love the book! What do I love about it? So far everything, every segment in the book. Is great for separating the invasive species from native species. It is a handy book for helping to determine some plants to add to my native garden.
customer_reviews.author: Sue Burke

customer_reviews.title: Can't due without it
customer_reviews.text: This book is perfect. I am able to drive, and identify many more plants along the road that I wondered about for so long....
customer_reviews.author: pam howitt

customer_reviews.title: Benefits for casual and serious plant lovers!
customer_reviews.text: The photos are very helpful, as well as the line drawings and the divisions into leaf and branching categories. The layman will benefit as much as the botanists.
customer_reviews.author: Norma B. Webb

customer_reviews.title: Wildflower Book
customer_reviews.text: We used this book for our Nature area to help with Merit Badges at Boy Scout Summer camp. Came on time and worked well.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great for looking up and categorizing the different flowers. Very helpful

customer_reviews.title: NAS Field Guide NA Wildflowers East..
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use, pictures and descriptions very specific. The fungi information is very clear -can identify with confidence. Appreciate the seasonal references.

customer_reviews.title: Great detailed book!
customer_reviews.text: This identification book was just what I was looking for. The photos are great, color charts, and regions are defined in areas together.
customer_reviews.author: Christine_Cato

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: These audubon field guide books are great. Beautifully bound and easy to use with great photographs and detailed descriptions of each species. Also, they are the perfect size for your shirt or pants pocket.

customer_reviews.title: Educational and accurate
customer_reviews.text: Always interested in wildflowers and this books is a great help in identifying them. Highly recommend this book for anyone interested in wildflowers.

customer_reviews.title: Audubon guide for wildflowers very useful
customer_reviews.text: Very good key for differentiating flowers; pictures really help. Complimented wildflowers of Tennessee which has good pictures but no key.
customer_reviews.author: waynepotter

customer_reviews.title: wildflower book
customer_reviews.text: this is the first book i have ordered on wildflowers. I is a very organized book with top quality pictures. I recommend this book!
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: National Aububon Filed Guide Flower Book
customer_reviews.text: The book was in perfect - like "brand new" I gave it to my daughter as a present and she was happy with it. I may look for another one to purchase from Amazon! Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Maryann

customer_reviews.title: I really like this one.
customer_reviews.text: I like it. It's better then some of the other field guide books that I have seen. I would love a all in one (Trees, flowers, and vines) but wildflowers is a good place to start! Nice book. I'd buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Renee

customer_reviews.title: Love the updated photos
customer_reviews.text: I have always liked these guides and the Wildflowers (Eastern N.A.) guide is a great all-around resource that has never let me down with regard to plant identification.
customer_reviews.author: Incurable Romantic

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: This was exactly what I needed to help me identify the flowers that I photograph. I was able to quickly find some flowers that I saw in the Grand Teton National park and others from the hills in Eastern Missouri.
customer_reviews.author: PhotoHome1

customer_reviews.title: Great guide
customer_reviews.text: Great pictures and descriptions, maps & illustrations; great guide. It's easy to find the flowers you're looking for by flipping through the categorized photographs, then looking up the description from there.
customer_reviews.author: Peter L Pollet

customer_reviews.title: national audubon society field guide to north american wildflowers eastern region
customer_reviews.text: Many very good photos,but too much back flipping and cross referencing to get a good field ID. Good home reference but not an easy field guide.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful informative book, my wife was pleased to receive on her birthday

customer_reviews.text: Great book. I owned it many years ago but it was misplaced during several moves. Ordered another because I thought it was clear and informative.
customer_reviews.author: DONNA KRIPFGANS

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful book with great pictures. Easy to use. Came on time in great condition even though was stated as used.
customer_reviews.author: ariela

customer_reviews.title: Great guide!
customer_reviews.text: This guide is full of beautiful photos, and is easy to use. It is a little heavy though.
customer_reviews.author: Tempest Jrock

customer_reviews.title: National Audubon Society Field Guide to North American Wildflowers: Eastern Region
customer_reviews.text: I love This Book , And This spring plan on using it aot, I live in the country and have alot of woods around me . I reccomned this book to any one , This is a book that good to have around no matter what
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Laughlin

customer_reviews.title: small print sabotage
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful pictures---unreadable text. I've packed it for return immediately when I found that the small, grey print was impossible to read even with my reading glasses and bright light. Why do publishers try to save money by making a handbook this user unfriendly?
customer_reviews.author: caroline paulson

customer_reviews.title: No Maps!
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed that the guide did not contain maps, such as the bird guides. The first flower I tried to look up (Wisteria) was not included.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: I was very disappointed in the quality
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed in the quality. The book contents are good, but the poor condition left a lot to be desired. I will NOT buy from this vendor again.
customer_reviews.author: Beverly

customer_reviews.title: Color pictures make plant identification easy. Everything you want to know included in the ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my go-to book. Color pictures make plant identification easy. Everything you want to know included in the text, and includes maps. Very durable soft cover... nice size, and travels in a backpack easily. Excellent resource for hikers and campers.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Moses
